alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 11:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Carver, Scott and Sibley Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns, Sherburne and Wright Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Up to a half-inch of additional rainfall through Friday morning is expected to prolong high river flows through the end of this week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water begins to encroach on roads along the East Bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Thursday, the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 930 AM CDT Thursday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 04/07/1943. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
